snippet: Joseph Herscher, a 26-year-old computer programmer and kinetic artist, turned his Brooklyn apartment into a laboratory where he builds real-world Rube Goldberg machines.
abstract: Joseph Herscher, a 26-year-old computer programmer and kinetic artist, has turned his Brooklyn apartment into a laboratory where he builds real-world Rube Goldberg machines.
lead_paragraph: Joseph Herscher, a 26-year-old computer programmer and kinetic artist, turned his Brooklyn apartment into a laboratory where he builds real-world Rube Goldberg machines.

headline.seo: Man Embraces Useless Machines, and Absurdity Ensues
headline.main: Who Says Machines Must Be Useful?
